summary: David Ferrie was a figure of interest in the JFK assassination investigation. He was associated with anti-Castro Cuban groups and individuals, and his name appears in connection with Lee Harvey Oswald and the Civil Air Patrol Cadets (CAPC) in New Orleans. Documents mention possible illegal activities and suspicious conversations involving Ferrie. He had limited association with Phillip Geraci, and Jimmy Johnson made phone calls regarding Ferrie's activities. The documents suggest Ferrie's involvement in anti-Castro activities and connections to individuals who were also of interest in the JFK assassination investigation.
significance: David Ferrie's significance in the JFK context stems from his connections to Lee Harvey Oswald and his involvement in anti-Castro activities. His name appears in multiple investigations and interviews related to the assassination, making him a person of interest in understanding the events surrounding the assassination.
